alert.note: Alert for Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 4:56PM CDT until September 02 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Irion, Sterling and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mertzon, Sherwood, Arden, Tankersley, Knickerbocker and Us-67 Near The Irion-Tom Green County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, Ranch Road 853 crossing east Rocky Creek, Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek, Ranch Road 853 crossing Middle Concho River, County Road 113 crossing Dove Creek, Burma crossing, crossings along County Road 411, County Road 202 crossing Lopez Creek, Sherwood Cemetery crossing and County Road 202 crossing Spring Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
